faculties_accepted: Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences (FASS)
module_restrictions: The Carl-Benz-School / International Department offers an international Bachelor study program in English at the Department of Mechanical Engineering with restricted admission, which only offers limited access to exchange students.
visa_info: EU citizens and citizens from Australia, Canada, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Liechtenstein, Monaco, New Zealand, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland, and the United States do not need a visa to enter Germany. Students from all other countries must apply for a visa for study purposes via the German diplomatic representation in their home country.
accommodations_info: Most students in Karlsruhe live in dormitories or share a flat. KIT cannot guarantee the availability of accommodation but will assist all exchange students settling down in Karlsruhe. Students will be informed about housing possibilities within 8 weeks of the application deadline. KIT reserves rooms for students from partner universities in their students’ residences if possible. These furnished single rooms cost about €355 and have a set lease period from March to August. No other moving in/out date is possible. A contract ending in August or September requires payment until August or September with no refund if the student leaves earlier.
cost_of_living:
The estimated monthly living expenses in Karlsruhe are as follows:

- Accommodation: €355
- Insurance: €80
- Transport: €34
- Food: €168
- Others (Books, entertainment etc.): €265

The monthly estimate for living expenses is €902. Students from partner universities also pay a social contribution of about €77.70 per semester.
